controls.title: Ensure system-wide crypto policy is not legacy
controls.description: The system-wide crypto policy defines which cryptographic algorithms are allowed for use on the system.
controls.rationale: The legacy policy allows older, less secure cryptographic algorithms that may be vulnerable to attack.
controls.audit:
Run the following command and verify the output is not LEGACY:
# update-crypto-policies --show
DEFAULT
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to set the system-wide crypto policy:
# update-crypto-policies --set DEFAULT
OR
# update-crypto-policies --set FUTURE
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 3.10 Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
v7: 14.4 Encrypt All Sensitive Information in Transit

controls.title: Ensure system-wide crypto policy is FUTURE or FIPS
controls.description: The system-wide crypto policy can be set to FUTURE or FIPS for enhanced security.
controls.rationale: The FUTURE policy provides stronger cryptographic algorithms, while FIPS ensures compliance with Federal Information Processing Standards.
controls.audit:
Run the following command and verify the output is FUTURE or FIPS:
# update-crypto-policies --show
FUTURE
OR
FIPS
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to set the system-wide crypto policy:
# update-crypto-policies --set FUTURE
OR
# update-crypto-policies --set FIPS
controls.impact: Some applications may not work with FUTURE or FIPS policies.
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 3.10 Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
v7: 14.4 Encrypt All Sensitive Information in Transit
